posts.name: James
posts.cooked:
Our team is trying to schedule and cancel commands, but the problem is most of the time the command is left over and called again if we choose a similar functioning, but different button. If we press the right align button, it works. If we back up and press the left align, it will go to the right part of the reef. We are using YAGSL for this. Here is our code.

Here is the subststem methods used:

Our GitHub is here: GitHub - FRC3546/2025-Reefscape-Competition

Thanks for the help!

posts.name: Jay Ticku
posts.cooked:
You can use DeferredCommand to make sure that a new command is generated each time the button is pressed. My team doesn’t use java, but here is an example of how we are implementing it in python:

Quick question about your implementation. I found it interesting that you translating the pose of the AprilTag to a pose that the robot should be at. Were you able to find success with this function? I tried a similar thing but the pose that it was generating was incorrect.

posts.name: James
posts.cooked: We have quite a bit of success with it, we do have some offsets that we add to translate the robot so it is a couple of inches away from the reef. We do have a random, intermittent issue where path planner ignores our max acceleration and tries to go to a different part of the reef. Otherwise it works well.

posts.name: Jay Ticku
posts.cooked: Also, I see that you guys are using pathfind to pose to get the robot to drive to the desired pose. Do you guys notice the pathfinding taking a while to generate the trajectory before the robot started moving? When testing out our align function, I notice that our robot takes about a second before it starts moving. Do you guys have any ideas on how to speed this up?

posts.name: James
posts.cooked: Sometimes we do notice a pause, but we haven’t determined if that is because we had our acceleration turned way down

posts.name: Jay Ticku
posts.cooked: No, I mean that there is always about a 1 second delay between pressing the button and our robot driving to the reef. We have some similar code with performing translation, so I don’t think that is taking one second to calculate. Do you think the python pathfinding algorithm implementation is slower or could it be another issue?

posts.name: James
posts.cooked: Thinking back on our cycles, I think you might be right. We might be having the same issue. It may also be that it does take time for pathplanner to generate a trajectory

posts.name: Jay Ticku
posts.cooked: Do you think there might be a way to speed this up? During a scrimmage, we found that the delay was pretty significant and increased our cycle time. I posted a question about this on Chief Delphi but no one responded with any ideas.

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
James
posts.cooked: I think so too, but when we don’t have .schedule() , the command does not run

posts.name: James
posts.cooked: We tried using a DeferredCommand, but we were unable to execute our command using it

posts.name: Jay Ticku
posts.cooked: Can you post the code you are using?

posts.name: James
posts.cooked: Our GitHub is here: GitHub - FRC3546/2025-Reefscape-Competition

posts.name: Jay Ticku
posts.cooked: The last update I see to your codebase was yesterday. Can you please put the code that you are trying to use?

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
You’ve double-coded the command. You turned a command into a runnable that had to turn it into a command. You can remove the extraneous stuff.

edit; sorry, I’m slow to see what you are trying to do. This might be what’s happening and I add lots of print statements to verify program flow and correctness. In command factories the statements before the return are run once and the actual command in the return could be run repetitively but with a fresh copy from the factory. But the command that is returned appears to be essentially static as the arguments to driveToPose wouldn’t change since they are local variables. Class field variables can be changed and accessed anew by a command but not local variables.

posts.name: James
posts.cooked: Is there a better way to schedule running these paths? It would also be nice if we were able to cancel the paths from running in case there is a behavior we do not like

posts.name: Jay Ticku
posts.cooked: Here is all of the relevant code that we are using to accomplish this that could be causing the DeferredCommand to not work for you. We also have the ability to stop the path with the Y button.

Hello my team is trying to do the exact same thing. I’m really trying to understand how this whole thing works so I wont be able to help you but I had some questions. First are you keeping track of your position on the field at all times or zeroing out and lining up with the april tag in sight. Also once you get your position how does this get run by the robot? return AutoBuilder.pathfindToPose( pose, constraints, edu.wpi.first.units.Units.MetersPerSecond.of(0) // Goal end velocity in meters/sec );
